summary: The 'Healing Partnerships for Survivors Act' (S. 2348) amends the Family Violence Prevention and Services Act to provide grants for strengthening partnerships between health and wellness providers, behavioral health programs, and community-based sexual assault programs. These grants aim to support survivors of sexual assault across their lifespan, including adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse. The bill authorizes funding for these grants, technical assistance, and administrative expenses. It also includes provisions for privacy, reports, and evaluations of the funded programs.
